alert.note: Alert for Conway; Faulkner; Garland; Johnson; Logan; Montgomery; Perry; Polk; Pope; Saline; Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 08 at 1:53PM CST until February 08 at 3:40PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 340 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON FOR CONWAY, NORTHWESTERN FAULKNER, GARLAND, PERRY, POPE, NORTHWESTERN SALINE, CENTRAL YELL, SOUTHERN JOHNSON, NORTHEASTERN LOGAN, MONTGOMERY AND SOUTHERN POLK COUNTIES... At 153 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Conway, Hot Springs, Russellville, Hot Springs Village, Clarksville, Morrilton, Danville, Perryville, Mount Ida, Dardanelle, Greenbrier, Atkins, Pottsville, Lamar, Dover, Ola, London, Wooster, Oppelo and Mountain Pine. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

area.areaDesc: Conway; Faulkner; Garland; Johnson; Logan; Montgomery; Perry; Polk; Pope; Saline; Yell
